title: Criticism of the Bible - Collection 27
description:
Criticism of the Bible - Collection 27:

We  have 31 titles in this upload:

-  Abegg & Flint - The Dead Sea Scrolls Bible (1999)

-  Amphoux & Elliott (Eds.) - Textual Research on the Psalms and Gospels (2012)

-  Bernstein - Reading and Re-Reading Scripture at Qumran, Vols. 1 & 2 (2013)

-  Berthelot & Ezra (Eds.) - Aramaica Qumranica; Proc. of the Conf. on the Aramaic Texts from Qumran in Aix-en-Provence, 30 June-2 July, 2008 (2010)

-  Bickerman - Studies in Jewish and Christian History, 2 Volumes (2007)

-  Carmichael - Sex and Religion in the Bible (2010)

-  Carr - The Formation of the Hebrew Bible; a New Reconstruction (2011)

-  Dimant & Kratz (Eds.) - Rewriting and Interpreting the Hebrew Bible; the Biblical Patriarchs in the Light of the Dead Sea Scrolls (2013)

-  Finkelberg & Stroumsa (Eds.) - Homer, the Bible, and Beyond; Literary and Religious Canons in the Ancient World (2003)

-  Green - The Bible, the School, and the Constitution; the Clash That Shaped Modern Church-State Doctrine (2012)

-  Green & McDonald (Eds.) - The World of the New Testament; Cultural, Social, and Historical Contexts (2013)

-  Luttikhuizen (Ed.) - The Creation of Man and Woman; Interpretations of the Biblical Narratives in Jewish and Christian Traditions (2000)

-  Martinez (Ed.) - Echoes from the Caves; Qumran and the New Testament (2009)

-  McLaren - The Secret Message of Jesus; Uncovering the Truth That Could Change Everything (2006)

-  Murdoch - The Apocryphal Adam and Eve in Medieval Europe (2009)

-  Niehoff (Ed.) - Homer and the Bible in the Eyes of Ancient Interpreters (2012)

-  Pelham - Contested Creations in the Book of Job; the World as It Ought and Ought Not to Be (2012)

-  Pokorny - From the Gospel to the Gospels; History, Theology and Impact of the Biblical Term 'Euangelion' (2013)

-  Porter & Pitts (Eds.) - Christian Origins and Greco-Roman Culture; Social and Literary Contexts for the New Testament (2013)

-  Porter & Pitts (Eds.) - Christian Origins and Hellenistic Judaism; Social and Literary Contexts for the New Testament (2013)

-  Robinson - Who Translates; Translator Subjectivities Beyond Reason (2001)

-  Saebo (Ed.) - Hebrew Bible Old Testament; the History of Its Interpretation, III-I, the 19th Century (2013)

-  Simon - Critical History of the Text of the New Testament; Wherein Is Established the Truth of the Acts on Which the Christian Religion Is Based (2013)

-  Smith - The Bible Made Impossible; Why Biblicism Is Not a Truly Evangelical Reading of Scripture (2012)

-  Stovell - Mapping Metaphorical Discourse in the Fourth Gospel; John's Eternal King (2012)

-  Tite - The Apocryphal Epistle to the Laodiceans; an Epistolary and Theoretical Analysis (2012)

-  Troward - Bible Mystery and Bible Meaning (1931)

-  VanderKam - The Dead Sea Scrolls and the Bible (2012)

-  VanderKam & Flint - The Meaning of the Dead Sea Scrolls (2002)

-  Westphal - Whose Community, Which Interpretation; Philosophical Hermeneutics for the Church (2009)

-  Worthington - Principles of Akkadian Textual Criticism (2012)
